summary: This document is a series of emails from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to SEC officials, appealing the denial of his whistleblower award application. He alleges widespread SEC corruption, obstruction of investigations, and facilitation of financial fraud involving Knight Capital (NITE/Virtu), Blackstone, and various other entities and individuals. The emails detail claims of market manipulation, money laundering, naked short selling, and connections to political figures.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, alleging SEC corruption and financial fraud related to Knight Capital, Blackstone, and other entities. He is appealing the denial of his whistleblower award.

persons.name: Steve Schwarzman
persons.context: Alleged to be near the top of the SEC's 'do not investigate' list and involved in orchestrating frauds related to Knight Capital and Eastman Kodak (KODK).

persons.name: Jason New
persons.role: Blackstone Board Member, KODK Board Member
persons.context: Described as a Blackstone representative on the KODK board, involved in an internal investigation cover-up.

persons.name: Dick Best
persons.context: Newly appointed SEC director, previously at FINRA. Dilorio questions if he criminally obstructed investigations related to his claims.

persons.name: Lara Shalov Mehraban
persons.context: SEC attorney accused of corruption and obstruction, with alleged former ties to Paul Weiss and Dougie Cifu of Virtu.

persons.name: Dougie Cifu
persons.context: CEO or senior executive at Virtu Financial (which owns NITE). Allegedly former boss/colleague of Lara Mehraban at Paul Weiss and central to the alleged fraud.

persons.name: Jay Clayton
persons.context: SEC Chairman accused of undisclosed conflicts due to his former firm Sullivan & Cromwell's (Sull Crom) representation of Knight/Virtu.

persons.name: Jared Fishman
persons.context: Sullivan & Cromwell attorney linked to Jay Clayton, accused of playing a key role in keeping NITE/Virtu operational.

persons.name: David Urban
persons.role: Board Member of NITE/Virtu and FSD Pharma
persons.context: Trump campaign manager and board member at NITE and money laundering shell FSD Pharma (HUGE).

persons.name: Michael Farkas
persons.role: CEO of Blink Charging (BLNK), Bag Man
persons.context: Alleged 'bag man' involved in money laundering shells like SkyWay and Blink Charging, linked to Trump and Epstein.

persons.name: Jonathan Farkas
persons.context: Trump fundraiser and alleged business partner of Jeffrey Epstein, linked to Michael Farkas.

persons.name: Bill Richardson
persons.context: Linked to Jeffrey Epstein and his New Mexico Zorro Ranch, and mentioned in connection with BLNK.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.context: Alleged 'bag man' barred by FINRA but still operating, involved in money laundering shells like those connected to Blink Charging.

persons.name: Joshie Sason
persons.context: Alleged 'bag man' involved in Hanover/Magna and other shell companies, subject of an SEC complaint based on Dilorio's information.

persons.name: Alex Ioffe
persons.role: CFO at Virtu Financial (formerly CFO at Interactive Brokers)
persons.context: CFO at Virtu, previously CFO at Interactive Brokers (IBKR) during the period covered by an SEC complaint against IBKR.

persons.name: Janey
persons.context: SEC official (likely in the Office of the Whistleblower) who is the primary recipient of Dilorio's emails and appeals.

persons.name: Hoecker
persons.context: SEC official (likely in Enforcement or OWB) frequently copied on Dilorio's emails regarding obstruction and award denial.

persons.name: Jay
persons.context: SEC official (likely Jay Clayton or another official) referenced in emails regarding conflicts and obstruction.

connections.description: Jason New is a Blackstone board member placed on the KODK board, acting on behalf of Blackstone's interests.
Alleged former boss/colleague relationship at law firm Paul Weiss; Dilorio claims they 'chat often' and Mehraban obstructs investigations to protect Cifu.
Both formerly of Sullivan & Cromwell; alleged to have worked together, with Fishman playing a key role in keeping NITE/Virtu running.
Whistleblower corresponding extensively with SEC official Janey regarding his award application and allegations of obstruction.
Implied to be related (possibly brothers); both are 'bag men' involved in financial fraud and connected to Trump/Epstein.
Described as 'BFF's' (best friends forever); Schwarzman is a prolific GOP donor and connected to Trump.
Described as a business partner of Jeffrey Epstein.
Linked to Jeffrey Epstein and his New Mexico Zorro Ranch.
Trump campaign manager and board member at companies alleged to be money laundering shells.
Connected to Kushner, as mentioned in the context of the KODK 'grift'.

events.title: Knight Capital Trading Glitch and Bailout
events.description: A trading glitch at Knight Capital Group caused its stock to collapse from over $10 to nearly $2.50, followed by a bailout by Blackstone, Jefferies, Goldman Sachs, and others with a convertible note at a deep discount.

events.title: Phlow Corporation Government Contract
events.description: Phlow Corporation awarded a $354 million government contract to manufacture essential medicines, including hydroxychloroquine, as a COVID-19 response.

events.title: KODK Pharmaceutical Pivot Announcement
events.description: President Trump announced Eastman Kodak (KODK) would pivot to pharmaceutical ingredient manufacturing, causing its stock to surge from $2 to $90, alleged to be a pump-and-dump scheme.

events.title: NITE/Virtu Q2 2020 Earnings Report
events.description: Virtu Financial (NITE) reported Q2 2020 earnings, showing a receivable of $2.44 billion, which Dilorio alleges is fraudulent accounting for naked short fails.

events.title: Blink Charging (BLNK) PR Pump
events.description: Blink Charging issued a press release about a grant for charging stations, driving its stock up 27% without filing an 8-K, alleged to be a fraudulent pump-and-dump.

events.title: SEC Charges UBS with AML Violations
events.description: SEC charged UBS Financial Services with failing to report suspicious transactions, resulting in a $5 million penalty. Dilorio claims this action was based on his whistleblower information.

events.title: FBI Leak on Private Equity Money Laundering
events.description: Reuters article based on a leaked FBI document expressing concerns that private equity and hedge funds are being used for large-scale money laundering.

locations: 14 Wall Street, New York, NY (Allied Wallet/WireCard address)
keyFacts: The whistleblower alleges the SEC has a 'Do Not Investigate Club' that protects powerful entities like Blackstone and Steve Schwarzman from scrutiny.
Knight Capital/NITE/Virtu is accused of being a criminal enterprise whose core business is abusive naked short selling of OTC market shells to facilitate money laundering, with SEC facilitation.
Multiple connections are drawn between the alleged financial frauds and prominent political figures, including Donald Trump, Jared Kushner, and Trump fundraiser Jonathan Farkas.
Several individuals mentioned (Jonathan Farkas, Bill Richardson) are explicitly linked to Jeffrey Epstein, connecting the financial fraud allegations to the Epstein case.

The SEC is accused of actively obstructing investigations based on the whistleblower's information while using that same information to bring lesser charges against other entities, thereby protecting the main perpetrators.
